job_title: Associate Professor in Sioux Falls, SD
pros: Great campus, a growth focused institution, with financial supports

job_title: Residence Hall Director in Sioux Falls, SD
pros: We had a tight community of coworkers at Augustana. My coworkers made the not so fun job a lot better. The culture was awesome!
cons: My department, Student Affairs, had many issues. A change in leadership (both department and institutionally) resulted in lack of communication. We were over worked and expected to dedicate late nights and weekends Augustana. There was no work-life balance. The senior leadership team does not seem connected to the university at all. Departments are constantly changing and if you accept a job, they can easily change your job description. Unfortunately, after looking at reviews it seems like there has been a shift since 2018 in the University and the job satisfaction seems to have greatly gone down. There is a very high turnover rate in the Student Affairs Department.

job_title: Archaeologist I in Sioux Falls, SD
cons: Low Compensation, Little Room for Advancement

job_title: Director of Student Conduct in Sioux Falls, SD
pros: Loved the flexible leadership and community feel. Treated me with respect and trusted me. Great perks and benefits.
cons: It has become more top down leadership lately.

job_title: Chapel Staff in Sioux Falls, SD
pros: Great community. A spirit of true teamwork and Christian Fellowship is present. People care about you and treat each other quite decently.
cons: Not as many hours of work are available

job_title: Assistant Professor in Sioux Falls, SD
pros: Sioux Falls is a very nice and safe community.  Strong health care and finance industry in community.  Students are curious, engaged and hard working.
cons: Senior Management completely disconnected from university.  Don’t care about faculty or staff. President is a former politician with no previous experience in higher education and it shows.  President claims to be transparent but is not.  Many long time employees leaving.  Pay is very low for industry and region.  Too many high paid and ineffective administrators for such a small school.

job_title: Pharmacy Clerk in Sioux Falls, SD
pros: Meeting a lot of fantastic people, both fellow employees and users of our services. Accommodating of school schedule.
cons: Quite a bit of micromanaging, and an unfair "recovery system" for late shifts.

job_title: Student Ambassador in Sioux Falls, SD
pros: Very nice adult colleagues, student employees are treated well, very reasonable and flexible hours, good balance and variety of tasks
cons: The pay is minimum wage, and you get no more than six hours per week. If you're looking for a serious paycheck, go elsewhere. If you want a few extra bucks, this job is perfect.
